citation.article-title: Catellatospora, a new genus of the Actinomycetales.

p.s: Description of Catellatospora citrea sp. nov.
Catellatospora citrea (cit're.a. L. adj. citrea lemon yellow)
Yellow vegetative hyphae, particularly on oatmeal agar and Hickey-Tresner agar medium.
Neither soluble nor melaninlike pigments are produced.
Utilizes L-arabinose, lactose, D-galactose, D-glucose, D-mannose, melibiose, L-rhamnose, salicin, starch, sucrose, and Dxylose.
No growth on adonitol, erythritol, myo-inositol, D-fruCtOSe, D-mannitol, raffinose, or D-ribose.
Doubtful utilization of glycerol and a-methyl-D-glucoside .
No growth in the presence of 3% NaCl.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 71.5 Â± 0.5 mol%.
The type strain of C. citrea is IFO 14495T (6183-ET).
